snippet: Eamon Kelly, a 65-year-old gang chief called “The Godfather” by Dublin’s tabloid press, was shot up to six times as he fled from a lone gunman, a police detective said.
abstract: Eamon Kelly, senior figure in Ireland's criminal underworld, is shot to death in Dublin two years after surviving similar assassination bid, in latest chapter of long-running feud involving Irish Republican Army die-hards; Real IRA paramilitary group is suspected in killing.
lead_paragraph: Eamon Kelly, a 65-year-old gang chief called “The Godfather” by Dublin’s tabloid press, was shot up to six times as he fled from a lone gunman, a police detective said.

headline.main: Irish Crime Boss Is Assassinated on Second Try
headline.print_headline: Ireland: Crime Boss Is Assassinated on Second Try
